name: (DEMO) The Art Of Humanizing A Pixel
name_original: (DEMO) The Art Of Humanizing A Pixel
description:
(THIS GAME IS A PROTOTYPE DEMO WITH LIMITED ENDINGS AND GAMEPLAY, READ DESCRIPTION FOR MORE DETAILS ON THE GAME!)

You have just gotten your hands on Consolation Innovations brand new terminal computer! Included with your purchase is a complimentary software from their survey division. The Art of Humanizing a Pixel. 

They will be nearby.

This game was created for a University of Toronto class, and is meant to feel like a 1980s retro-futuristic take on the themes of Oscar Wilde's The Picture of Dorian Gray.

This game is a conceptual prototype of what I plan to ultimately make a game with dozens of endings. As of now, there are only 3. 

There are also 7 secrets to discover. Can you find them all?

Music was written and commissioned by Scott Warren, and performed by the talented MojoKing.

(Remember, not everything as it seems...)

Demo does not have a quit button. You must close it manually.

Requires decent GPU to run the game at a consistent FPS, the DEMO does not have any settings. (Will add full functionality in full game)

Stay tuned for more updates, videos, and games from Sayincraft Studios!
